clinical_study.brief_title: Mycoprotein and Pea Protein Blend and Muscle Protein Synthetic Response
clinical_study.official_title: Comparing Postprandial Muscle Protein Synthesis Rates Following the Consumption of Mycoprotein, Pea Protein and a Mycoprotein/Pea Protein Blend in Resistance Trained Individuals

brief_summary.textblock:
Dietary protein is vital for the preservation of health and optimal adaptation to training. Plant proteins are considered inferior to animal proteins with respect to their ability to stimulate an acute muscle building response and therefore support long-term muscle reconditioning. Pea protein is a highly commercially available plant proteins source (available as supplements, food ingredients etc.), yet there is no research investigating its ability to stimulate a muscle building response. The investigators aim to assess the effect of consuming pea protein on muscle protein synthesis rates and compare these results to mycoprotein, a source known to elicit a robust anabolic response.
Pea protein is lower in some of the essential amino acids, namely methionine, which could mean it is less effective compared with mycoprotein which has a more complete amino acid profile. So in addition to comparing pea with mycoprotein, the investigators also want to compare to a blend of pea and mycoprotein to see if replenishing the amino acid content in pea 'rescues' the anabolic response. In this study, the investigators will be using two types of blends to assess whether the process by which a protein source is produced effects the muscle building response.

primary_outcome.description: The rate of synthesis of new muscle protein (Fractional synthetic rate %/h)

secondary_outcome.description: The appearance of amino acids from the protein drink in the circulation.
Basal and postprandial concentrations of serum insulin
Locality of mTOR within the muscle cell

secondary_outcome.measure: mTOR phosphorylation via ATP kinase assay
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of mTOR that has been activated in the muscle cell

arm_group.description: Bolus ingestion of mycoprotein providing 25g of protein.
Bolus ingestion of pea protein providing 25g of protein.
Bolus ingestion of mycoprotein/pea protein dry blend providing 25g of protein.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Bolus ingestion of mycoprotein/pea protein extrudate blend
arm_group.description: Bolus ingestion of mycoprotein/pea protein extrudate blend providing 25g of protein.

intervention.arm_group_label: Bolus ingestion of mycoprotein/pea protein extrudate blend

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI between 18 and 30
- Resistance trained
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any metabolic impairment
- Smoking
- Use of over the counter pharmaceuticals (excluding oral contraceptives and contraceptive devices).
- A personal family history of epilepsy, seizures or schizophrenia.
- Allergic to Quorn/mycoprotein/edible fungi/environmental mould products.
- Any motor disorder.
